content.body: At the last TG3 meeting, I volunteered to figure out what we used `exports` (a list of all exported names) for on `ModuleSource`. The answer is somewhat weak…
content.formatted_body: At the last TG3 meeting, I volunteered to figure out what we used exports (a list of all exported names) for on ModuleSource. The answer is somewhat weak…

content.body: The virtual module source “handler” must contain a property that describes all the names it exports and all the specifiers it imports and reexports.

There is no firm reason that the schema of the virtual module source handler should be identical to a `ModuleSource`, and we don’t currently use the `exports` property of actual/vicious `ModuleSource` instances for anything.
content.formatted_body: There is no firm reason that the schema of the virtual module source handler should be identical to a ModuleSource, and we don’t currently use the exports property of actual/vicious ModuleSource instances for anything.

content.body: I personally have a strong æsthetic preference that, if `ModuleSource` and a virtual `ModuleSource` communicate the same information that they use the same schema.
content.formatted_body: I personally have a strong æsthetic preference that, if ModuleSource and a virtual ModuleSource communicate the same information that they use the same schema.
